s0062.chinese: 彗星見西方，又見北方，從斗以南八十日。
s0062.literal: A comet appeared in the west and again in the north, extending south from the Dipper constellation for eighty days.
s0062.idiomatic: A comet appeared in the west and again in the north, extending south from the Dipper constellation for eighty days.

s0063.chinese: 十年，相國呂不韋坐嫪毐免。
s0063.literal: In the tenth year, Prime Minister Lü Buwei was dismissed for his connection with Lao Ai.
s0063.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Prime Minister Lü Buwei was dismissed for his connection with Lao Ai.

s0065.literal: Qi and Zhao came to hold banquets.
s0065.idiomatic: Qi and Zhao came to hold banquets.

s0066.chinese: 齊人茅焦說秦王曰：「秦方以天下為事，而大王有遷母太后之名，恐諸侯聞之，由此倍秦也。」
s0066.literal: Mao Jiao of Qi persuaded the King of Qin, saying: "Qin is now concerned with all under Heaven, yet Your Majesty has the reputation of exiling his mother the Queen Mother; I fear the feudal lords will hear of this and thereby turn against Qin."
s0066.idiomatic: Mao Jiao of Qi persuaded the King of Qin, saying: "Qin is now concerned with all under Heaven, yet Your Majesty has the reputation of exiling his mother the Queen Mother; I fear the feudal lords will hear of this and thereby turn against Qin."

s0067.chinese: 秦王乃迎太后於雍而入咸陽，復居甘泉宮。
s0067.literal: The King of Qin then welcomed the Queen Mother from Yong and brought her into Xianyang, and she again resided at Ganquan Palace.
s0067.idiomatic: The King of Qin then welcomed the Queen Mother from Yong and brought her into Xianyang, and she again resided at Ganquan Palace.

s0068.chinese: 大索，逐客，李斯上書說，乃止逐客令。
s0068.literal: There was a great search and expulsion of foreign guests; Li Si submitted a memorial in persuasion, and the expulsion order was then halted.
s0068.idiomatic: There was a great search and expulsion of foreign guests; Li Si submitted a memorial in persuasion, and the expulsion order was then halted.

s0069.chinese: 李斯因說秦王，請先取韓以恐他國，於是使斯下韓。
s0069.literal: Li Si then persuaded the King of Qin to first take Han to intimidate the other states, so he sent Si to subdue Han.
s0069.idiomatic: Li Si then persuaded the King of Qin to first take Han to intimidate the other states, so he sent Si to subdue Han.

s0070.literal: The King of Han was troubled by this.
s0070.idiomatic: The King of Han was troubled by this.

s0071.literal: He plotted with Han Fei to weaken Qin.
s0071.idiomatic: He plotted with Han Fei to weaken Qin.

s0072.chinese: 大梁人尉繚來，說秦王曰：「以秦之彊，諸侯譬如郡縣之君，臣但恐諸侯合從，翕而出不意，此乃智伯、夫差、湣王之所以亡也。
s0072.literal: Wei Liao from Daliang came and persuaded the King of Qin, saying: "With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like commandery and county lords; I only fear the feudal lords will form a vertical alliance and suddenly act unexpectedly; this is how Zhi Bo, Fuchai, and King Min came to perish.
s0072.idiomatic: Wei Liao from Daliang came and persuaded the King of Qin, saying: "With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like commandery and county lords; I only fear the feudal lords will form a vertical alliance and suddenly act unexpectedly; this is how Zhi Bo, Fuchai, and King Min came to perish.

s0073.chinese: 願大王毋愛財物，賂其豪臣，以亂其謀，不過亡三十萬金，則諸侯可盡。」
s0073.literal: I hope Your Majesty will not begrudge wealth and treasures; bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans; spending no more than three hundred thousand gold, all the feudal lords can be eliminated."
s0073.idiomatic: I hope Your Majesty will not begrudge wealth and treasures; bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans; spending no more than three hundred thousand gold, all the feudal lords can be eliminated."

s0074.chinese: 秦王從其計，見尉繚亢禮，衣服食飲與繚同。
s0074.literal: The King of Qin followed his plan, treated Wei Liao with the highest courtesy, and shared clothing, food, and drink with Liao.
s0074.idiomatic: The King of Qin followed his plan, treated Wei Liao with the highest courtesy, and shared clothing, food, and drink with Liao.

s0075.chinese: 繚曰：「秦王為人，蜂準，長目，摯鳥膺，豺聲，少恩而虎狼心，居約易出人下，得志亦輕食人。
s0075.literal: Liao said: "The King of Qin is a person with a wasp-like nose, elongated eyes, a bird of prey's chest, a jackal's voice, little kindness and a tiger-wolf heart; when in difficulty he easily humbles himself before others, but when successful he easily devours people.
s0075.idiomatic: Liao said: "The King of Qin is a person with a wasp-like nose, elongated eyes, a bird of prey's chest, a jackal's voice, little kindness and a tiger-wolf heart; when in difficulty he easily humbles himself before others, but when successful he easily devours people.

s0076.chinese: 我布衣，然見我常身自下我。
s0076.literal: I am a commoner, yet when he sees me he personally humbles himself before me.
s0076.idiomatic: I am a commoner, yet when he sees me he personally humbles himself before me.

s0077.chinese: 誠使秦王得志於天下，天下皆為虜矣。
s0077.literal: If truly the King of Qin achieves his ambitions over all under Heaven, all under Heaven will become slaves.
s0077.idiomatic: If truly the King of Qin achieves his ambitions over all under Heaven, all under Heaven will become slaves.

s0078.literal: One cannot associate with him for long."
s0078.idiomatic: One cannot associate with him for long."

s0080.chinese: 秦王覺，固止，以為秦國尉，卒用其計策。
s0080.literal: The King of Qin realized this, firmly detained him, made him National Commander of Qin, and in the end used his strategies.
s0080.idiomatic: The King of Qin realized this, firmly detained him, made him National Commander of Qin, and in the end used his strategies.
